title: Compressor Open Winding
description: The outdoor unit's condenser fan runs, but the compressor won't start. The capacitor tests good and the contactor is pulling in properly.

faults.description: Compressor run winding is open - internal thermal overload or winding failure

diagnosticSteps.action: Check voltage at contactor output with system calling
diagnosticSteps.hint: This confirms power is reaching the compressor circuit

diagnosticSteps.action: Turn off power, discharge, and test capacitance
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Should be within 10% of rated value
diagnosticSteps.hint: A failed capacitor can prevent motor starting

diagnosticSteps.action: With power OFF, measure resistance between all terminal pairs
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: C-R: low ohms, C-S: slightly higher, R-S: sum of C-R and C-S
diagnosticSteps.hint: OL (infinite) reading indicates an open winding

diagnosticSteps.action: Measure resistance from each terminal to compressor case/ground
diagnosticSteps.expectedResult: Should read OL (infinite) on all terminals
diagnosticSteps.hint: Any reading indicates a grounded winding

learningObjectives: Diagnose compressor winding failures using resistance testing
Understand the C-R-S terminal arrangement on hermetic compressors
Interpret open circuit readings on a multimeter
Differentiate between capacitor and compressor failures
